title: Question 1
prompt:
In paragraph 4, the narrator describes Henry as being "fed and caressed at station after station" and treated like a hero, so much so that he actually began to believe he had "within him the strength to do mighty deeds of arms."

Based on what you have read, what are the dangers of such hero worship, especially for a young and inexperienced person?
feedback: In this passage, Henry's experience of hero worship does, for a brief time, make him think that "he must be a hero," even though he has not yet experienced battle. The correct answer accurately describes the dangers of hero worship. None of the incorrect answers are supported by the text.
